awd_titl_txt: Synthetic Methods and Total Synthesis in Organic Chemistry
awd_abstract_narration: The Synthetic Organic Program will support the research of Dr.                  Gilbert Stork of the Department of Chemistry at Columbia                        University.  Dr. Stork will continue his highly innovative                      studies on the development of new synthetic strategies.  The                    research is centered around the development of highly regio-                    and stereoselective methods for the construction of organic                     structures from the relatively simple to the relatively complex.                                                                                                Dr. Stork will focus on several areas including the control of                  regio- and stereochemistry via radical cyclization processes                    and their application to total synthesis; the control of regio-                 and stereochemistry by enforcing intramolecularity on normal                    intermolecular reactions via a temporary, removable silicon (or                 metal) connector linking the two normally separated reactive                    fragments; and on the use of guanidine systems embedded in                      suitable frameworks for probing molecular recognition.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
